items.title: Who is Alan Dye? Apple's key design executive behind liquid glass, Apple Watch UI, iOS7, poached by Meta
items.summary: Alan Dye, one of Apple's key design executives behind some of the company's most iconic rollouts including the Apple Watch UI, iOS7, and Liquid Glass UI, is leaving the tech giant to join rival Meta Platforms.

items.title: Airline pilots hide mental health struggles to keep flying
items.summary: A Delta pilot died by suicide, highlighting a culture of fear among commercial aviators who conceal mental health struggles, fearing license revocation. Pilots avoid seeking help due to strict regulations, lengthy reviews, and stigma, even when treatment could improve safety. Reforms are urged to protect pilots and expedite their return to duty.

items.title: RBI Ombudsman grievance data shows high retail discontent: Remedial measures, please
items.summary: Grievance data from RBI’s report on its Ombudsman Scheme shows a sharp rise in complaints. Much discontent can be traced to the private sector’s aggressive retail push of recent years. Is the RBI governor’s caution at risk of falling on deaf ears?

items.title: Mint Quick Edit | As the rupee sinks past 90, look at the bright side of a subtle shift in policy
items.summary: A record-low rupee and the utterances of policymakers are consistent with a shift to a lightly managed currency float. While this may cushion India against trade turmoil, it also reduces interference with monetary policy.

items.title: Share Market Live Updates 4 December 2025: Sensex, Nifty edge up, lifted by tech stocks rally
items.summary:
Sensex, Nifty live updates on 4 December 2025: Benchmark indices traded marginally higher in afternoon session on Thursday, with the Sensex up 146.63 points at ₹85,253.44 and the Nifty rising 41.40 points to 26,027.40, as investors remained cautious ahead of the Reserve Bank of India’s monetary policy announcement on Friday.

Information technology stocks led the gains, with TCS advancing 1.80 per cent to ₹3,237.10 and Tech Mahindra also rising 1.80 per cent to ₹1,569.40. Other IT gainers included HCL Tech, up 1.28 per cent at ₹1,661.50, and Infosys, which climbed 1.15 per cent to ₹1,596.80. S

items.title: Myntra Beauty drives new customer acquisition, riding the Gen Z and premiumisation wave
items.summary: Nearly 60% of Myntra’s beauty shoppers are Gen Z, who spend twice as much as other cohorts, while international beauty demand continues to rise in smaller cities and towns

items.title: Rajasthan's luxury hotel boom: Global chains rush in as big-fat weddings drive demand
items.summary: Rajasthan is witnessing a surge in luxury hotel openings as global chains expand to tap rising demand driven by billionaire weddings and premium tourism. Udaipur is leading the boom with hundreds of new high-end rooms.

items.title: New pilot-rest rules from November 1 trigger major IndiGo disruptions and passenger woes
items.summary: IndiGo has cancelled or delayed hundreds of flights as new pilot rest rules, in effect from November 1, strain crew availability. Poor planning, tech glitches, winter congestion, and pilot shortages have worsened disruptions, leaving passengers frustrated.

items.title: Race for Talent Is On as Bankers Brace for IPO Boom in Vietnam
items.summary: Vietnam’s potential upgrade to emerging-market status by FTSE Russell in September has investment banks bulking up staff in anticipation of a flood of initial public offerings.

items.title: PB Balaji's reign at JLR begins with twin crises
items.summary: Balaji's tenure as Jaguar Land Rover's new chief executive began on a turbulent note, marked by the abrupt sacking of chief creative officer Gerry McGovern and severe financial fallout from a recent cyberattack.

items.title: Rupee slide not a worry, says CEA V Anantha Nageswaran as FDI set to top $100 billion
items.summary: Chief Economic Adviser V Anantha Nageswaran downplayed concerns over the rupee's depreciation, stating it's not pressuring inflation and expecting recovery next year. He also highlighted the need for India to "up its game" to attract higher FDI inflows amidst a shifting global economic landscape, while experts noted the rupee's relative stability compared to other emerging market currencies.

items.title: India's smartphone export to U.S. triples to $1.47 billion in October
items.summary: According to data, India's worldwide smartphone exports rose from $10.68 billion to $15.95 billion in April-October 2025, marking a 49.35% expansion

items.title: Ola Electric deploys 250-member taskforce to clear service backlogs, signals major after-sales overhaul
items.summary: The newly mobilised taskforce has been coordinating closely with service centres, backed by real-time communication channels to address all kinds of delays ranging from battery replacements to routine repairs

items.title: Nepal, India to discuss supply of aviation fuel through pipeline
items.summary: Officials from the two countries are set to hold a meeting next week in New Delhi, said an official at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Will GST 2.0 consumption boost help Nirmala Sitharaman adhere to fiscal glide path?
items.summary: India's economy is ending the fiscal year strongly. Landmark tax reforms and firm fiscal discipline are key drivers. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is preparing Budget 2026. This budget will focus on strategic spending and economic stability. Global challenges are present. GST collections remain steady after rate cuts. This indicates ongoing economic activity and better compliance.

items.title: Defence boom pushing law firms to deploy specialists
items.summary: The specialists, often former senior defence and government officials, help law firms create viable bid strategies for clients seeking defence contracts. Their experience is also invaluable during tough negotiations and compliance reviews. Also much in vogue are tech experts including engineers and technology-domain specialists, especially in aerospace, avionics, electronics, AI/ML systems, unmanned platforms, secure communications and dual-use tech.

items.title: Trump ‘saved AI industry’, says Jensen Huang amid reported meeting between US President and Nvidia CEO
items.summary: Speaking on an episode of The Joe Rogan Experience, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang ‘flat out’ that the current growth of the AI industry in the US would not have been possible without Trump's energy policies. Trump reportedly also met Huang on Wednesday.

items.title: ET Graphics: As Rupee breaches 90, a look at who loses and who gains
items.summary: The rupee has hit a historic low against the dollar. This slide raises concerns about import costs and stock market stability. However, the economy shows resilience with strong growth and low inflation. Experts are examining who is affected by this currency movement and who might benefit from it.

items.title: More than rupee level, its non-volatility is key: Bajaj
items.summary: Sanjiv Bajaj, the chairman of Bajaj Finserv, expressed confidence in the rupee's fair value while emphasizing the need to manage its volatility. He downplayed concerns about the rupee potentially reaching 90 against the dollar, highlighting that a low-interest rate climate is conducive to growth in India's manufacturing and infrastructure sectors.

items.title: '8th Economic Census to be held in 2027': Statistics Secretary Saurabh Garg
items.summary: India will conduct its eighth Economic Census in 2027. This census will follow the population census. Data from the Economic Census will establish a statistical business register. This register will map all enterprises across states. It will track their operational status. The Economic Census provides vital information for policy decisions. The population census is scheduled for 2026 and 2027.

items.title: 'Reduce dependence on any single geography for long-term resilience': Piyush Goyal
items.summary: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal has urged Indian industry to identify weaknesses and innovate for future growth. He stressed reducing reliance on any single country due to the weaponization of trade. Goyal highlighted India's strong economic performance with 8.2% growth and low inflation. He emphasized self-sufficiency in critical products and strengthening domestic supply chains.

items.title: Opening up nuclear power sector to private firms - An overview
items.summary: India's nuclear energy sector is getty ready for a significant transformation. New laws are being introduced to boost nuclear power capacity to 100 GW by 2047. These changes will allow private companies to participate and address concerns regarding liability and fuel supply. This move aims to meet rising energy demands and support India's growth as a developed economy.

items.title: Labour codes likely to be fully operational from April 1, 2026, Govt to pre-publish draft rules soon
items.summary: Since labour is a concurrent subject, appropriate governments — Centre and States — will have to notify the rules under the four codes to enforce these fully across the country

items.title: 'Draft Atomic Energy Bill in advanced stage, taking in all ministry inputs': Jitendra Singh
items.summary: India's Atomic Energy Bill 2025 is in its final stages. The government is incorporating suggestions and legal reviews. Discussions with Russia's Rosatom are progressing on nuclear energy cooperation. This includes developing both large and small nuclear power plants. Focus is also on localizing equipment production. Small modular reactors are a key area of discussion.

items.title: CII president Rajiv Memani bats for fresh manufacturing reforms, sovereign wealth fund
items.summary: India must implement new measures to boost manufacturing and supply chain strength. A sovereign wealth fund is proposed to support advanced manufacturing and critical minerals.  The Confederation of Indian Industry suggests using disinvestment funds for long-term transformation.  This plan aims to reduce import dependence and foster local production, creating significant economic value.

items.title: Higher pharma, chemicals exports to Russia bloc on agenda to trim deficit
items.summary: India is negotiating a trade deal with the Eurasian Economic Union to increase exports of pharmaceuticals, chemicals, and engineering goods. The agreement aims to reduce India's trade deficit with Russia. Discussions focus on product categories and potential restrictions. This move comes ahead of Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit. The EAEU market presents significant opportunities for Indian businesses.

items.title: Japan's JFE, JSW forge ₹15,750-cr steel JV
items.summary: In a landmark collaboration, JSW Steel is joining forces with JFE Steel in a massive ₹15,750 crore venture, acquiring Bhushan Power & Steel's facility in Odisha. This transformative agreement is anticipated to cut JSW Steel's debt load by nearly 50%, paving the way for accelerated growth and enhanced operational capacity at Bhushan Power & Steel beyond its current milestones.

items.title: Hindujas looking for strategic partner in IndusInd Bank, but will not dilute stake
items.summary: The bank now has a capital adequacy ratio of over 17%, so it does not need funds. As a promoter, we have always stated that whenever funds are required, it will be provided, says Ashok Hinduja, chairman, IndusInd International Holdings (IIHL).

items.title: Macquarie leads race for stake in Maple Infrastructure Trust
items.summary: La Caisse aims to raise $350 million (₹3,155 crore) via the stake sale and has appointed Rothschild to manage the process. The InvIT has an enterprise value of around ₹16,000 crore ($2 billion). Maple Infrastructure Trust is sponsored by Maple Highways, La Caisse's dedicated road platform in India.

items.title: UPS put profits over safety before plane crash that killed 14, lawyer alleges
items.summary: UPS put profits over safety before plane crash that killed 14, lawyer alleges

items.title: Cheaper fitout costs keep office leasing on growth path
items.summary: India's office leasing is breaking records. This is due to lower costs for office rentals and fitouts. Global companies are choosing India to expand. They are creating modern workplaces focused on employee well-being and technology. This trend is expected to continue, boosting the office fitout market. India's affordability and evolving workplace designs are key factors.

items.title: JSW Steel eyes sharp debt reduction through joint venture deal with Japan’s JFE
items.summary: The deal, anchored by JFE’s  ₹15,750-crore commitment, is expected to nearly halve JSW Steel’s debt and ring-fence the BPSL assets under a clean JV structure.

items.title: NPST secures  ₹300 crore investment from Tata Mutual Fund to fuel global expansion and AI-first strategy
items.summary: Following the allotment, Tata Mutual Fund’s shareholding in NPST will increase to 9.42%, a substantial endorsement of the company's growth trajectory and market position

items.title: Sugs Lloyd secures  ₹43.37 crore power infrastructure order from PSPCL
items.summary: The order, precisely valued at  ₹43,37,82,924, is designated for Loss Reduction Works on a turnkey basis under the central government's Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS) in Punjab.

items.title: IndiGo flights delayed nationwide by new pilot rostering rules, leaves
items.summary: Technology glitches, schedule changes linked to the winter season, adverse weather conditions, increased congestion in the aviation system and implementation of updated crew rostering rules had a negative compounding impact.

items.title: Manufacturing must be innovation-led, says Goyal; November exports recover after sharp October fall
items.summary: Commerce minister Piyush Goyal said that India’s manufacturing sector must shift towards innovation and resilient supply chains to achieve Viksit Bharat by 2047.

items.title: IndiGo flight cancellations point to failure of proactive resource planning: Pilots' grouping ALPA
items.summary: The Airline Pilots' Association of India (ALPA) criticized IndiGo's operational disruptions, attributing them to poor resource planning and a potential attempt to pressure the DGCA into weakening new flight duty time limitation norms. IndiGo cited FDTL issues for cancelling over 100 flights, a move ALPA suggests highlights a failure in proactive management and regulatory oversight.

items.title: Strong political push to seal India-EU FTA by 2025-end, says EU Ambassador
items.summary: The EU and India are committed to finalizing their Free Trade Agreement by the end of 2025, with 11 out of 23 chapters already closed. Key areas like market access for cars and services remain under negotiation. This strategic partnership, representing 25% of global GDP and population, aims to boost bilateral trade, currently at $136 billion.

items.title: IndiGo cancellations explained: What went wrong, what it means for your ticket, and how to get a refund
items.summary: IndiGo faced widespread operational chaos, cancelling over 200 flights and causing hundreds of delays due to crew shortages, new duty regulations, and airport system failures. Thousands of passengers were impacted as the airline's on-time performance plummeted. IndiGo is now implementing corrective measures and offering refunds or alternative flights to affected travelers.

items.title: Debt gap rises to 50-year high in developing countries: World Bank
items.summary: Developing nations face a severe debt crisis. The gap between debt repayments and new financing has reached a 50-year peak. External debt for these countries hit a record high in 2024. India's external debt also saw an increase. However, India benefited from bond index inclusions and increased lending. South Asia experienced significant net inflows, largely directed to India.

items.title: Budget 2026: A look into how India’s manufacturing & services sector is performing before Feb 1 announcements
items.summary: India's business activity remains strong despite global headwinds, with services sector accelerating while manufacturing moderates.  US tariffs and waning festive demand impacted factory output, yet robust domestic demand fueled services growth.  Despite a dip in export orders and overall business optimism, the economy shows resilience, with upcoming budget decisions crucial for future growth.

items.title: Telcos gross revenue nears Rs 1 lakh crore mark in September 2025 quarter
items.summary: Telecom service providers in India achieved a record gross revenue of Rs 99,828 crore in the September quarter of 2025-26, marking a 9.19% year-on-year increase. Adjusted Gross Revenue (AGR) also saw a significant rise of 9.35% to Rs 82,348 crore, with major players like Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel driving this growth.

items.title: Ex-Flipkart executive Jeyandran Venugopal takes over at Reliance Retail Ventures
items.summary: At Flipkart, Venugopal was the Chief Product and Technology Officer and had played a pivotal role in driving the e-commerce platform’s growth, customer engagement, expansion and strengthening its leadership

items.title: NHPC synchronises first unit of 2,000-MW Subansiri Lower hydel project
items.summary: State-owned NHPC Ltd. has successfully synchronised Unit 2 of the Subansiri Lower Hydroelectric Project with the national grid. This marks a significant step towards the project's completion. Upon full operation, it will contribute substantial renewable energy, aiding India's carbon neutrality goals. Further units are scheduled for connection, boosting the nation's power output.

items.title: NCLAT says Committee of Creditors has right to appoint liquidator for debt-ridden firm, not NCLT
items.summary: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) ruled that only the Committee of Creditors (CoC) can appoint a liquidator for a company undergoing insolvency if the Resolution Professional (RP) hasn't provided written consent. The NCLAT set aside NCLT's appointments, stating the tribunal can only replace an RP, not appoint a liquidator independently of the CoC's choice.

items.title: Pesticides industry body CCFI objects to ICMR study
items.summary: The researchers in the study have also identified that pesticide exposure is a risk for development of these neuropsychiatric disorders of neuro-inflammatory origin

items.title: Budget 2026: How India’s inflation evolved over the past year
items.summary: Budget 2026: A comprehensive look at India’s inflation trajectory over the last year ahead of Budget 2026, shows that India's economic narrative is shaped by a disinflationary trend, with both retail and wholesale price indices softening significantly. This shift allows the Finance Minister to focus on growth support in the upcoming Budget 2026, as inflation settles comfortably within the RBI's tolerance band.

items.title: Targeting public debt is suitable in the current uncertain times, says CEA Nageswaran
items.summary: Creating a rule that cannot be adhered to on an annual basis damages credibility, says chief economic advisor V. Anantha Nageswaran.

items.title: DGCA investigates IndiGo flight disruptions; asks airline to submit mitigation plans
items.summary: IndiGo flights face widespread cancellations and delays. The aviation watchdog DGCA is investigating the situation. The airline has been asked to explain the disruptions. IndiGo is also to present plans to reduce future flight issues. Passengers are experiencing significant inconvenience. The airline is making schedule adjustments to normalize operations.

items.title: Policy alignment key to unlocking private investment, says Sanjiv Bajaj, CII
items.summary: Sanjiv Bajaj says Customs duty changes, FTAs and PLI schemes must move in step with State-level reforms on land, labour, power and water

items.title: Exports record healthy growth in November: Piyush Goyal

items.title: Skip college? Zoho's Sridhar Vembu flags cultural shift in Americans, warns Indian parents against heavy student debt
items.summary: Zoho co-founder Sridhar Vembu highlighted a cultural shift among American students, where people are choosing to forgo their college degrees. Vembu also warned Indian parents against heavy student debt and to let students chart their own paths.

items.title: Midcaps to outperform large, small caps in FY27: Kotak MF
items.summary: Equity returns in this fiscal are likely to be anchored in earnings growth, with India Inc expected to deliver double-digit growth in FY27

items.summary: Protection Plus is a non-par, linked, life, individual savings plan, which offers life insurance cover-cum-savings throughout the term of the policy

items.title: What caused the chaos at IndiGo
items.summary: IndiGo faces widespread flight delays and cancellations, impacting hundreds of services due to new pilot rest and duty-hour norms. The airline's unpreparedness, stemming from poor planning and insufficient hiring, has led to significant disruptions during peak travel season, frustrating passengers and exposing operational challenges.

items.title: India contracts over 100,000 tonnes of sugar for export, more likely amid weakening INR
items.summary: Countries like Afghanistan and Sri Lanka are keen to import Indian sugar, and there’s growing chatter about advocating for an additional million tonnes to help lift domestic prices and support local mills

items.title: World Bank warns developing world 'not out of danger' as debt costs hit record
items.summary: In its annual International Debt Report, the Washington-based lender also found that overall interest payments had hit a fresh record of $415.4 billion in 2024 despite some relief from falling global interest rates.

items.title: Ola Electric’s sales drop, while others gain market share
items.summary: Ola Electric’s market share fell to to 15.3% during the YTD period this year, as compared with 35.5% in the year-ago period.

items.title: Piyush Goyal asks industry to lower dependence on single geography amid trade weaponisation
items.summary: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal urged industries to identify vulnerabilities, innovate, and diversify supply chains to ensure long-term resilience, citing the "weaponization of trade." He highlighted India's strong economic growth of 8.2% and robust foreign exchange reserves, emphasizing the need for self-sufficiency in critical sectors and deeper global integration.

items.summary: Industry sources said Singh brought the much needed stability in management at ONGC, helping reverse the decade-long decline in production of crude oil

items.summary: Naveen Valsakumar said that the company has seen a strong growth of 40% each year over the last 2 years primarily driven by an increase in revenue from its tech-enabled DIY self publishing platform

items.title: JPMorgan accelerates India expansion, leases new office in Hyderabad
items.summary: JPMorgan Chase has sub-leased a significant 176,000 sq ft facility in Hyderabad, marking one of the largest financial services deals in the city this year. This expansion underscores the company's growing investment in India's global capability center ecosystem and its commitment to supporting global operations through its Indian hubs.

items.title: FedEx expands Bengaluru hub, doubles capacity with new 60,000 sq ft facility
items.summary: The semi- automated hub can process up to 4,000 packages per hour, supporting rising demand from electronics, auto components, and SME-driven e-commerce exports

items.title: Ola Consumer pauses food services as it reworks non-core portfolio
items.summary: The move comes as Ola undertakes a restructuring of its non-core portfolio.

items.title: CDSCO directs pharmacies to display QR code and toll-free number for reporting adverse drug reactions
items.summary: The CDSCO has mandated that all retail and wholesale pharmacies across India must prominently display a QR code and a toll-free number. This initiative aims to simplify reporting of adverse drug reactions by the public and healthcare professionals through India's PvPI Adverse Drug Reaction Monitoring System. The directive follows a recent Pharmacovigilance Programme of India meeting.

items.title: Finolex Industries announces leadership appointments to drive next growth phase
items.summary: Udipt Agarwal, 56, brings more than three decades of experience in the chemicals, bio-industrial and specialty materials sectors and Rambabu Sanka, 63, has nearly 40 years of experience in chemical manufacturing, particularly in VCM/PVC operations

items.title: Higher duties on cigarettes will be shared with the States, Sitharaman clarifies in Lok Sabha
items.summary: The Lok Sabha on December 3 passed the Central Excise (Amendment) Bill, 2025, which would see higher excise duties being imposed on cigarettes.

items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India's Monetary Policy Committee is meeting to decide on interest rates. Markets expect a rate cut, but some experts believe the RBI might hold rates steady. Inflation is falling, and economic growth is strong. The committee's decision will be announced on Friday.

items.summary: You will hear a lot more about successful engagements with many trading countries soon, the Minister said

items.summary: Amendments to the Atomic Energy Act, 1962 and the Civil Liability for Nuclear Damage Act, 2010 are being taken up to encourage private sector investment, says Minister of State for Power Shripad Naik

items.summary: Healthify, a digital health startup, is concentrating on the US market to drive revenue, with expectations of reaching double-digit millions next year. The firm is also expanding its partnerships in India’s anti-obesity drug sector.

items.title: MoRTH launches all-India mission to clear NH encroachments using drones, apps
items.summary: Encroachment removal will take place under the Control of National Highways (Land and Traffic) Act, relevant rules, and the August 7, 2025 SOP, with support from local administration where needed.

items.summary: Ciplostem is a single-dose intra-articular injection designed to work at the cellular level to reduce inflammation, relieve pain, improve joint mobility and preserve cartilage.

items.title: Haryana RERA directs Chintels to refund homebuyer’s money with interest
items.summary: Haryana RERA has ordered builder Chintel to refund a buyer Rs 1.7 crore with 10.85% annual interest. The buyer sought a refund after the Chintel Paradiso housing society partially collapsed in February 2022. The authority also awarded Rs 2 lakh for mental agony and Rs 50,000 for litigation costs.

These measures are expected to improve the resolution process and protect creditor interests.

items.title: Stock Market Highlights today December 2, 2025: Sensex tanks nearly 504 pts, Nifty slips to 26,032 on selling in bank stocks, Reliance
items.summary:
Sensex, Nifty, Share Prices Highlights: Stock markets declined on Tuesday, with the benchmark Sensex tumbling nearly 504 points due to selling in blue-chip bank stocks and Reliance Industries, and persistent foreign fund outflows.

Falling for the third straight session, the 30-share BSE Sensex tumbled 503.63 points or 0.59 per cent to settle at 85,138.27. During the day, the benchmark tanked 588.9 points or 0.68 per cent to hit a low of 85,053. The index had scaled a record high level in intra-day trade in the previous session, but closed lower due to profit booking in the second half.
